summary: Damascus, the capital of Syria, is one of the oldest cities in the world, with a rich history dating back to 3000 BC. Known as "City of Jasmine," it has been an important cultural hub in the Arab world. The city has been ruled by many, including the Umayyad Caliphate and the Abbasid dynasty. Damascus played a significant role in Islamic history and is considered a holy city by some Muslims. Despite war-related challenges, it remains Syria's political center. The Old City of Damascus is famous for landmarks like the Umayyad Mosque and the Mausoleum of Saladin.
title: Damascus
